page.title: 06Farm and Packing,Birlingham.
page.content: My mum works at Revill's all the year round. She pulls onions and cleans them. There are a hundred bunches in a crate. If the onions are small , she puts 25 onions to a bunch, and if they're big , 10 to a bunch. Then she puts a rubber band around the top and bottom. There are English and Japanese onions. In the winter, when the onions are frozen, a tractor comes with a digger on the back and lifts the onions up out of the ground. If the onions are frozen solid, the workers pull leeks.{Revill's Packing Station:- My mum is a Horticultural worker. She works on a conveyor belt packing spring and summer cabbage. I asked mum how it was packed. She said it is cut, put into crates and brought into the packing shed, where the cabbages are put in plastic bags and then into boxes. The boxes are taken to market.
